problem_text:
5.9. Self-adjointness of the Laplacian in a weighted L2-space
Let ρ ∈ L1_loc(Rn), ρ > 0, and let
L2(ρ) = { u : ∫_{Rn} |u(x)|^2 ρ(x) dx < ∞ }.
In 1990 Eidus [14] proved that for n ≥ 3 a necessary condition for the operator ρ^{-1}∆ in L2(ρ) to be self-adjoint is
∫_{Rn} ρ(x) dx = ∞. (5.8)
One can replace (5.8) by
∫_{Rn \ F} ρ(x) dx = ∞ (5.9)
for all closed sets F with finite harmonic capacity (see [71, Section 17.1]).
Problem. Show that (5.9) is not sufficient and find a sharp sufficient condition for the self-adjointness of ρ^{-1}∆ in L2(ρ).
